ir:
For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable initialized will be updated to 0.
- the state variable raisedamount will be updated to 0.

For the tokensAvailable function.
- it calls an external function balanceOf of the external contract token with the address of this contract as the argument.

For the destroy function.
- For owner:
  - it calls an external function balanceOf of the external contract token with the address of this contract as the argument, and gets the returned value as v0.
  - When v0 is greater than 0:
    - it calls an external function transfer of the external contract token with the following argument list: owner, and v0.
    - the contract will be destroyed and its balance will be sent to owner.

For the initialize function.
- For owner, and initialized equals to 0:
  - it calls an external function balanceOf of the external contract token with the address of this contract as the argument, and gets the returned value as v0.
  - When v0 equals to 0x1cf389cd46047d03000000:
    - the state variable initialized will be updated to 1.

For the transferOwnership function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- When the first argument does not equal to 0, and for owner:
  - the state variable owner will be updated to the first argument.

For the payable fallback function.
- the state variable raisedamount will be updated to (raisedamount+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
- it calls an external function transfer of the external contract token with the following argument list: caller, and (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*2200).
- it transfers the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) to owner.

For the payable buyTokens function.
- the state variable raisedamount will be updated to (raisedamount+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
- it calls an external function transfer of the external contract token with the following argument list: caller, and (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*2200).
- it transfers the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) to owner.

messages.content: You are an experienced smart contract developer that excels at Solidity program languages. Please write a contract code by the following contract descriptions. Some state variables are provided to help you develop.

The following is the description of the contract logic: For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable initialized will be updated to 0.
- the state variable raisedamount will be updated to 0.

For the tokensAvailable function.
- it calls an external function balanceOf of the external contract token with the address of this contract as the argument.

For the destroy function.
- For owner:
  - it calls an external function balanceOf of the external contract token with the address of this contract as the argument, and gets the returned value as v0.
  - When v0 is greater than 0:
    - it calls an external function transfer of the external contract token with the following argument list: owner, and v0.
    - the contract will be destroyed and its balance will be sent to owner.

For the initialize function.
- For owner, and initialized equals to 0:
  - it calls an external function balanceOf of the external contract token with the address of this contract as the argument, and gets the returned value as v0.
  - When v0 equals to 0x1cf389cd46047d03000000:
    - the state variable initialized will be updated to 1.

For the transferOwnership function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- When the first argument does not equal to 0, and for owner:
  - the state variable owner will be updated to the first argument.

For the payable fallback function.
- the state variable raisedamount will be updated to (raisedamount+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
- it calls an external function transfer of the external contract token with the following argument list: caller, and (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*2200).
- it transfers the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) to owner.

For the payable buyTokens function.
- the state variable raisedamount will be updated to (raisedamount+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
- it calls an external function transfer of the external contract token with the following argument list: caller, and (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*2200).
- it transfers the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) to owner.

.
 Here are some state variables with their corresponding types: public state variable `owner` is typed address,public state variable `initialized` is typed bool,public state variable `token` is typed address,public state variable `raisedamount` is typed uint256.
